clinical_study.brief_title: Aerobic Interval Training in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Aerobic Interval Training in Patients With Paroxysmal or Persistent Atrial Fibrillation

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of aerobic interval training in patients with paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation, especially to see if the burden of atrial fibrillation and symptoms are reduced.

detailed_description.textblock: Long term endurance sport practice is associated with a higher incidence of atrial fibrillation. Moderate/light physical activity seems to be associated with a lower incidence. The underlying mechanisms are uncertain. In order to examine the effect of training in this population, the investigators will perform a randomised controlled study with aerobic interval training in patients with paroxysmal/persistent atrial fibrillation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in burden of atrial fibrillation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 4 weeks after ended intervention period
primary_outcome.description: Burden of atrial fibrillation(number of episodes, duration(percent of the day)) continually measured, and reported by the patient. Analysed for the patients in total, with sub analysis in the groups of paroxysmal and persistent AF and in those with a low burden of atrial fibrillation vs. those with a larger burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Size of left atrium and ventricle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after ended intervention period(12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Atrial and ventricular size will be evaluated by echocardiography and MRI.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after ended intervention period(12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin-6, pro-BNP, d-dimer and von Willenbrands factor are measured.

Baseline and after ended intervention period(12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Atrial and ventricular function measured by MR and echocardiography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after ended intervention period(12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Fibrosis in left atrium and left ventricle measured by MRI.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after ended intervention period(12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with SF-36, Symptom and Severity Checklist and EHRA score of AF- related symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Burden of atrial fibrillation in the intervention period
secondary_outcome.description: The intervention period is divided into 3 periods of 4 weeks each. The mean burden of atrial fibrillation(percent of time with atrial fibrillation) and number of episodes in each of those periods will be assessed to see if exercise changes the amount of fibrillation.

intervention.description: Aerobic interval training will be performed with 4 times of 4 minutes intervals at an intensity of 90-95% of maximum heart rate and active pauses of 3 minutes between intervals. 3 times a week for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation, that are able to perform aerobic interval training.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Performing high intensity training (pulse >90% of max) for more than 2 times a week.
- Moderate intensity training more than 30 min, more than 3 times a week
- Previous open heart surgery
- EF <40%
- Significant aorta stenosis
- Mitral insufficiency, >gr. 2
- Pacemaker
- Earlier coronary intervention and not complete revascularization
